description: French bouffant, from Middle French; present participle of bouffer (“to puff”). Doublet of buffont.

adjectives.description: bouffant (comparative more bouffant, superlative most bouffant)

entries.meaning: Of hair or clothing, full-bodied or puffy; puffed out away from head or body.
examples: Her bouffant suit made her seem much heavier than her petite figure actually was.

entries.meaning: A puffy, round hairstyle, popular in the mid-to-late 16th century, characterized by hair raised high on the head and usually covering the ears or hanging down on the sides.
